data.name: 1.1 Ensure that corporate login credentials are used instead of Gmail accounts
data.description: Use corporate login credentials instead of Gmail accounts.

tests.title: Corporate Emails Only
tests.description: Ensures that no users are using their Gmail accounts for access to GCP.
tests.more_info: Gmail accounts are personally created and are not controlled by organizations. Fully managed accounts are recommended for increased visibility, auditing and control over access to resources.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that no users are actively using their Gmail accounts to access GCP.

results.message: Account is using Gmail login credentials

data.name: 1.3 Ensure that there are only GCP-managed service account keys for each service account
data.description: User managed service account should not have user managed keys.

tests.title: Service Account Managed Keys
tests.description: Ensures that service account keys are being managed by Google.
tests.more_info: Service account keys should be managed by Google to ensure that they are as secure as possible, including key rotations and restrictions to the accessibility of the keys.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure all user service account keys are being managed by Google.

data.name: 1.4 Ensure that ServiceAccount has no Admin privileges.
data.description: A service account is a special Google account that belongs to your application or a VM, instead of to an individual end user. Your application uses the service account to call the Google API of a service, so that the users aren't directly involved.

tests.title: Service Account Admin
tests.description: Ensures that user managed service accounts do not have any admin, owner, or write privileges.
tests.more_info: Service accounts are primarily used for API access to Google. It is recommended to not use admin access for service accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that no service accounts have admin, owner, or write privileges.

results.message: All service accounts have least access

data.name: 1.5 Ensure that IAM users are not assigned Service Account User role at project level
data.description: It is recommended to assign `Service Account User (iam.serviceAccountUser)` role to a user for a specific service account rather than assigning the role to a user at project level.

tests.title: Service Account User
tests.description: Ensures that no users have the Service Account User role.
tests.more_info: The Service Account User role gives users the access to all service accounts of a project. This can result in an elevation of privileges and is not recommended.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that no service accounts have the Service Account User role attached.

data.name: 1.6 Ensure user-managed/external keys for service accounts are rotated every 90 days or less
data.description: Service Account keys consist of a key ID (Private_key_Id) and Private key, which are used to sign programmatic requests that you make to Google cloud services accessible to that particular Service account.

tests.title: Service Account Key Rotation
tests.description: Ensures that service account keys are rotated within desired number of days.
tests.more_info: Service account keys should be rotated so older keys that that might have been lost or compromised cannot be used to access Google services.
tests.recommended_action: Rotate service account keys that have not been rotated in over defined threshold time.

data.name: 1.8 Ensure Encryption keys are rotated within a period of 365 days
data.description: Google Cloud Key Management Service stores cryptographic keys in a hierarchical structure designed for useful and elegant access control management. Access to resources.The format for the rotation schedule depends on the client library that is used.

tests.title: Key Rotation
tests.description: Ensures cryptographic keys are set to rotate on a regular schedule
tests.more_info: All cryptographic keys should have key rotation enabled. Google will handle the rotation of the encryption key itself, as well as storage of previous keys, so previous data does not need to be re-encrypted before the rotation occurs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that cryptographic keys are set to rotate.

data.name: 2.1 Ensure that Cloud Audit Logging is configured properly across all services and all users from a project
data.description: It is recommended that Cloud Audit Logging is configured to track all Admin activities and read, write access to user data.

tests.title: Audit Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that default audit logging is enabled on the organization or project.
tests.more_info: The default audit logs should be configured to log all admin activities and write and read access to data for all services. In addition, no exempted members should be added to the logs to ensure proper delivery of all audit logs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the default audit logs are enabled to log all admin activities and write and read access to data for all services.

results.message: Audit logging is not enabled on the project

data.name: 2.2 Ensure that sinks are configured for all Log entries
data.description: It is recommended to create sink which will export copies of all the log entries.

tests.title: Log Sinks Enabled
tests.description: Ensures a log sink is enabled to export all logs
tests.more_info: Log sinks send log data to a storage service for archival and compliance. A log sink with no filter is necessary to ensure that all logs are being properly sent. If logs are sent to a storage bucket, the bucket must exist and bucket versioning should exist.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure a log sink is configured properly with an empty filter and a destination.

data.name: 2.3 Ensure that object versioning is enabled on log-buckets
data.description: It is recommended to enable object versioning on log-buckets.

tests.title: Bucket Versioning
tests.description: Ensures object versioning is enabled on storage buckets
tests.more_info: Object versioning can help protect against the overwriting of objects or data loss in the event of a compromise.
tests.recommended_action: Bucket Versioning can only be enabled by using the Command Line Interface, use this command to enable Versioning: gsutil versioning set on gs://[BUCKET_NAME]
tests.remediation_description: Bucket versioning will be enabled on storage buckets

data.name: 2.4 Ensure log metric filter and alerts exists for Project Ownership assignments/changes
data.description: In order to prevent unnecessarily project ownership assignments to users/service-accounts and further misuses of project and resources, all `roles/Owner` assignments should be monitored.

tests.title: Project Ownership Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for project ownership assignments and changes
tests.more_info: Project Ownership is the highest level of privilege on a project, any changes in project ownership should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log metric and alert exist for project ownership assignments and changes.

data.name: 2.5 Ensure log metric filter and alerts exists for Audit Configuration Changes
data.description: Google Cloud Platform services write audit log entries to Admin Activity and Data Access logs to helps answer the questions of "who did what, where, and when?" within Google Cloud Platform projects.

tests.title: Audit Configuration Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for audit configuration changes.
tests.more_info: Project Ownership is the highest level of privilege on a project, any changes in audit configuration should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log alerts exist for audit configuration changes.

data.name: 2.6 Ensure log metric filter and alerts exists for Custom Role changes
data.description: It is recommended that a metric filter and alarm be established for changes IAM Role creation, deletion and updating activities.

tests.title: Custom Role Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for custom role creation and changes
tests.more_info: Project Ownership is the highest level of privilege on a project, any changes in custom role should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log alerts exist for custom role creation and changes.

data.name: 2.7 Ensure log metric filter and alerts exists for VPC Network Firewall rule changes
data.description: It is recommended that a metric filter and alarm be established for VPC Network Firewall rule changes.

tests.title: VPC Firewall Rule Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for firewall rule changes
tests.more_info: Project Ownership is the highest level of privilege on a project, any changes in firewall rule should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log metric and alert exist for firewall rule changes.

data.name: 2.8 Ensure log metric filter and alerts exists for VPC network route changes
data.description: It is recommended that a metric filter and alarm be established for VPC network route changes.

tests.title: VPC Network Route Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for VPC network route changes
tests.more_info: Project Ownership is the highest level of privilege on a project, any changes in VPC network route should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log metric and alert exist for VPC network route changes.

data.name: 2.9 Ensure log metric filter and alerts exists for VPC network changes
data.description: It is recommended that a metric filter and alarm be established for VPC network changes.

tests.title: VPC Network Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for VPC network changes
tests.more_info: Project Ownership is the highest level of privilege on a project, any changes in VPC network should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log metric and alert exist for VPC network changes.

data.name: 2.10 Ensure log metric filter and alerts exists for Cloud Storage IAM permission changes
data.description: It is recommended that a metric filter and alarm be established for Cloud Storage Bucket IAM changes.

tests.title: Storage Permissions Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for storage permission changes
tests.more_info: Storage permissions include access to the buckets that store the logs, any changes in storage permissions should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log metric and alert for storage permission changes.

data.name: 2.11 Ensure log metric filter and alerts exists for SQL instance configuration changes
data.description: It is recommended that a metric filter and alarm be established for SQL Instance configuration changes.

tests.title: SQL Configuration Logging
tests.description: Ensures that logging and log alerts exist for SQL configuration changes
tests.more_info: Project Ownership is the highest level of privilege on a project, any changes in SQL configurations should be heavily monitored to prevent unauthorized changes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that log metric and alert exist for SQL configuration changes.

data.name: 3.1 Ensure the default network does not exist in a project
data.description: To prevent use of `default` network, a project should not have a `default` network.

tests.title: Default VPC In Use
tests.description: Determines whether the default VPC is being used for launching VM instances
tests.more_info: The default VPC should not be used in order to avoid launching multiple services in the same network which may not require connectivity. Each application, or network tier, should use its own VPC.
tests.recommended_action: Move resources from the default VPC to a new VPC created for that application or resource group.

data.name: 3.3 Ensure that DNSSEC is enabled for Cloud DNS
data.description: DNSSEC in Cloud DNS enables domain owners to take easy steps to protect their domains against DNS hijacking and man-in-the-middle and other attacks.

tests.title: DNS Security Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that DNS Security is enabled on all managed zones
tests.more_info: DNS Security is a feature that authenticates all responses to domain name lookups. This prevents attackers from committing DNS hijacking or man in the middle attacks.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure DNSSEC is enabled for all managed zones in the cloud DNS service.

data.name: 3.4 Ensure that RSASHA1 is not used for key-signing key in Cloud DNS DNSSEC
data.description: DNSSEC algorithm numbers in this registry may be used in CERT RRs. Zone signing (DNSSEC) and transaction security mechanisms (SIG(0) and TSIG) make use of particular subsets of these algorithms.

tests.title: DNS Security Signing Algorithm
tests.description: Ensures that DNS Security is not using the RSASHA1 algorithm for key or zone signing
tests.more_info: DNS Security is a feature that authenticates all responses to domain name lookups. This prevents attackers from committing DNS hijacking or man in the middle attacks.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all managed zones using DNSSEC are not using the RSASHA1 algorithm for key or zone signing.

data.name: 3.5 Ensure that RSASHA1 is not used for zone-signing key in Cloud DNS DNSSEC
data.description: DNSSEC algorithm numbers in this registry may be used in CERT RRs. Zone signing (DNSSEC) and transaction security mechanisms (SIG(0) and TSIG) make use of particular subsets of these algorithms.

tests.title: DNS Security Signing Algorithm
tests.description: Ensures that DNS Security is not using the RSASHA1 algorithm for key or zone signing
tests.more_info: DNS Security is a feature that authenticates all responses to domain name lookups. This prevents attackers from committing DNS hijacking or man in the middle attacks.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all managed zones using DNSSEC are not using the RSASHA1 algorithm for key or zone signing.

data.name: 3.9 Ensure VPC Flow logs is enabled for every subnet in VPC Network
data.description: Flow Logs is a feature that enables you to capture information about the IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC Subnets. After you've created a flow log, you can view and retrieve its data in Stackdriver Logging.

tests.title: Flow Logs Enabled
tests.description: Ensures VPC flow logs are enabled for traffic logging
tests.more_info: VPC flow logs record all traffic flowing in to and out of a VPC. These logs are critical for auditing and review after security incidents.
tests.recommended_action: Enable VPC flow logs for each VPC subnet

data.name: 4.1 Ensure that instances are not configured to use the default service account with full access to all Cloud APIs
data.description: To support principle of least privileges and prevent potential privilege escalation it is recommended that instances are not assigned to default service account `Compute Engine default service account` with Scope `Allow full access to all Cloud APIs`.

tests.title: VM Instances Least Privilege
tests.description: Ensures that instances are not configured to use the default service account with full access to all cloud APIs
tests.more_info: To support the principle of least privilege and prevent potential privilege escalation, it is recommended that instances are not assigned to the default service account, Compute Engine default service account with a scope allowing full access to all cloud APIs.
tests.recommended_action: For all instances, if the default service account is used, ensure full access to all cloud APIs is not configured.

data.name: 4.2 Ensure "Block Project-wide SSH keys" enabled for VM instances
data.description: It is recommended to user Instance specific SSH key(s) instead of using common/shared project-wide SSH key(s) to access Instances.

tests.title: Instance Level SSH Only
tests.description: Ensures that instances are not configured to allow project-wide SSH keys
tests.more_info: To support the principle of least privilege and prevent potential privilege escalation it is recommended that instances are not give access to project-wide SSH keys through instance metadata.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure project-wide SSH keys are blocked for all instances.

data.name: 4.3 Ensure oslogin is enabled for a Project
data.description: Enabling OS login binds SSH certificates to IAM users and facilitates effective SSH certificate management.

tests.title: OS Login Enabled
tests.description: Ensures OS login is enabled for the project
tests.more_info: Enabling OS login ensures that SSH keys used to connect to instances are mapped with IAM users.
tests.recommended_action: Set enable-oslogin in project-wide metadata so that it applies to all of the instances in the project.

data.name: 4.4 Ensure 'Enable connecting to serial ports' is not enabled for VM Instance
data.description: If you enable the interactive serial console on an instance, clients can attempt to connect to that instance from any IP address.

tests.title: Connect Serial Ports Disabled
tests.description: Ensures connecting to serial ports is not enabled for VM instances
tests.more_info: The serial console does not allow restricting IP Addresses, which allows any IP address to connect to instance and should therefore be disabled.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the Enable Connecting to Serial Ports option is disabled for all compute instances.

data.name: 4.5 Ensure that IP forwarding is not enabled on Instances
data.description: Forwarding of data packets should be disabled to prevent data loss or information disclosure.

tests.title: IP Forwarding Disabled
tests.description: Ensures that IP forwarding is disabled on all instances
tests.more_info: Disabling IP forwarding ensures that the instance only sends and receives packets with matching destination or source IPs.
tests.recommended_action: IP forwarding settings can only be chosen when creating a new instance. Delete the affected instances and redeploy with IP forwarding disabled.

data.name: 5.1 Ensure that Cloud Storage bucket is not anonymously or publicly accessible
data.description: It is recommended that IAM policy on Cloud Storage bucket does not allows anonymous and/or public access.

tests.title: Storage Bucket All Users Policy
tests.description: Ensures Storage bucket policies do not allow global write, delete, or read permissions
tests.more_info: Storage buckets can be configured to allow the global principal to access the bucket via the bucket policy. This policy should be restricted only to known users or accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each storage bucket is configured so that no member is set to allUsers or allAuthenticatedUsers.

data.name: 5.3 Ensure that logging is enabled for Cloud storage buckets
data.description: It is recommended that storage Access Logs and Storage logs are enabled for every Storage Bucket.

tests.title: Bucket Logging
tests.description: Ensures object logging is enabled on storage buckets
tests.more_info: Storage bucket logging helps maintain an audit trail of access that can be used in the event of a security incident.
tests.recommended_action: Bucket Logging can only be enabled by using the Command Line Interface and the log bucket must already be created. Use this command to enable Logging: gsutil logging set on -b gs://[LOG_BUCKET_NAME] -o AccessLog  gs://[BUCKET_NAME]

data.name: 6.1 Ensure that Cloud SQL database instance requires all incoming connections to use SSL
data.description: It is recommended to enforce all incoming connections to SQL database instance to use SSL.

tests.title: Database SSL Enabled
tests.description: Ensures SQL databases have SSL enabled
tests.more_info: Enabling SSL ensures that the sensitive data being transferred from the database is encrypted.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that SSL is enabled on all SQL databases.

data.name: 6.2 Ensure that Cloud SQL database Instances are not open to the world
data.description: Database Server should accept connections only from trusted Network(s)/IP(s) and restrict access from the world.

tests.title: DB Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures that SQL instances do not allow public access
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, SQL instances should not have a public endpoint and should only be accessed from within a VPC.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that SQL instances are configured to prohibit traffic from the public 0.0.0.0 global IP address.

data.name: 6.4 Ensure that MySQL Database Instance does not allows root login from any Host
data.description: It is recommended that root access to a MySql Database Instance should be allowed only through specific white-listed trusted IPs.

tests.title: Any Host Root Access
tests.description: Ensures SQL instances root user cannot be accessed from any host
tests.more_info: Root access for SQL instance should only be allowed from whitelisted IPs to ensure secure access only from trusted entities.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that root access for SQL instances are not allowed from any host.

data.name: 7.1 Ensure Stackdriver Logging is set to Enabled on Kubernetes Engine Clusters
data.description: Stackdriver Logging lets you have Kubernetes Engine automatically collect, process, and store your container and system logs in a dedicated, persistent datastore.

tests.title: Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes clusters have logging enabled
tests.more_info: This setting should be enabled to ensure Kubernetes control plane logs are properly recorded.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that logging is enabled on all Kubernetes clusters.

data.name: 7.2 Ensure Stackdriver Monitoring is set to Enabled on Kubernetes Engine Clusters
data.description: Stackdriver Monitoring to monitor signals and build operations in your Kubernetes Engine clusters.

tests.title: Monitoring Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes clusters have monitoring enabled
tests.more_info: Kubernetes supports monitoring through Stackdriver.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure monitoring is enabled on all Kubernetes clusters.

data.name: 7.3 Ensure Legacy Authorization is set to Disabled on Kubernetes Engine Clusters
data.description: In Kubernetes, authorizers interact by granting a permission if any authorizer grants the permission. The legacy authorizer in Kubernetes Engine grants broad, statically defined permissions.

tests.title: Legacy Authorization Disabled
tests.description: Ensure legacy authorization is set to disabled on Kubernetes clusters
tests.more_info: The legacy authorizer in Kubernetes grants broad, statically defined permissions.
tests.recommended_action: Disable legacy authorization on all clusters.

data.name: 7.4 Ensure Master authorized networks is set to Enabled on Kubernetes Engine Clusters
data.description: Authorized networks are a way of specifying a restricted range of IP addresses that are permitted to access your container cluster's Kubernetes master endpoint.

tests.title: Master Authorized Network
tests.description: Ensures master authorized networks is set to enabled on Kubernetes clusters
tests.more_info: Authorized networks are a way of specifying a restricted range of IP addresses that are permitted to access your container clusters Kubernetes master endpoint.
tests.recommended_action: Enable master authorized networks on all clusters.

data.name: 7.5 Ensure Kubernetes Clusters are configured with Labels
data.description: A cluster label is a key-value pair that helps you organize your Google Cloud Platform resources, such as clusters. You can attach a label to each resource, then filter the resources based on their labels.

tests.title: Cluster Labels Added
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes clusters have labels added
tests.more_info: It is recommended to add labels to Kubernetes clusters to apply specific security settings and auto configure objects at creation.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure labels are added to Kubernetes clusters

data.name: 7.6 Ensure Kubernetes web UI / Dashboard is disabled
data.description: Dashboard is a web-based Kubernetes user interface. You can use Dashboard to deploy containerized applications to a Kubernetes cluster, troubleshoot your containerized application, and manage the cluster itself along with its attendant resources.

tests.title: Web Dashboard Disabled
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes clusters have the web dashboard disabled.
tests.more_info: It is recommended to disable the web dashboard because it is backed by a highly privileged service account.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that no Kubernetes clusters have the web dashboard enabled

data.name: 7.7 Ensure `Automatic node repair` is enabled for Kubernetes Clusters
data.description: Kubernetes Engine's node auto-repair feature helps you keep the nodes in your cluster in a healthy, running state. When enabled, Kubernetes Engine makes periodic checks on the health state of each node in your cluster.

tests.title: Automatic Node Repair Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes cluster nodes have automatic repair enabled
tests.more_info: When automatic repair on nodes is enabled, the Kubernetes engine performs health checks on all nodes, automatically repairing nodes that fail health checks. This ensures that the Kubernetes environment stays optimal.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that automatic node repair is enabled on all node pools in Kubernetes clusters

data.name: 7.8 Ensure Automatic node upgrades is enabled on Kubernetes Engine Clusters nodes
data.description: Node auto-upgrades help you keep the nodes in your cluster or node pool up to date with the latest stable version of Kubernetes.

tests.title: Automatic Node Upgrades Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes cluster nodes have automatic upgrades enabled
tests.more_info: Enabling automatic upgrades on nodes ensures that each node stays current with the latest version of the master branch, also ensuring that the latest security patches are installed to provide the most secure environment.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that automatic node upgrades are enabled on all node pools in Kubernetes clusters

data.name: 7.10 Ensure Basic Authentication is disabled on Kubernetes Engine Clusters
data.description: Basic authentication allows a user to authenticate to the cluster with a username and password and it is stored in plain text without any encryption. Disabling Basic authentication will prevent attacks like brute force.

tests.title: Basic Authentication Disabled
tests.description: Ensure basic authentication is set to disabled on Kubernetes clusters.
tests.more_info: Basic authentication uses static passwords to authenticate, which is not the recommended method to authenticate into the Kubernetes API server.
tests.recommended_action: Disable basic authentication on all clusters

data.name: 7.11 Ensure Network policy is enabled on Kubernetes Engine Clusters
data.description: A network policy is a specification of how groups of pods are allowed to communicate with each other and other network endpoints.

tests.title: Network Policy Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes clusters have network policy enabled
tests.more_info: Kubernetes network policy creates isolation between cluster pods, this creates a more secure environment with only specified connections allowed.
tests.recommended_action: Enable network policy on all Kubernetes clusters.

data.name: 7.13 Ensure Kubernetes Cluster is created with Alias IP ranges enabled
data.description: Google Cloud Platform Alias IP Ranges lets you assign ranges of internal IP addresses as aliases to a virtual machine's network interfaces.

tests.title: Alias IP Ranges Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes clusters have alias IP ranges enabled
tests.more_info: Alias IP ranges allow users to assign ranges of internal IP addresses as alias to a network interface.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Kubernetes clusters have alias IP ranges enabled.

data.name: 7.14 Ensure PodSecurityPolicy controller is enabled on the Kubernetes Engine Clusters
data.description: A Pod Security Policy is a cluster-level resource that controls security sensitive aspects of the pod specification.

tests.title: Pod Security Policy Enabled
tests.description: Ensures pod security policy is enabled for all Kubernetes clusters
tests.more_info: Kubernetes pod security policy is a resource that controls security sensitive aspects of the pod configuration.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all Kubernetes clusters have pod security policy enabled.

data.name: 7.15 Ensure Kubernetes Cluster is created with Private cluster enabled
data.description: A private cluster is a cluster that makes your master inaccessible from the public internet. In a private cluster, nodes do not have public IP addresses, so your workloads run in an environment that is isolated from the internet.

tests.title: Private Cluster Enabled
tests.description: Ensures private cluster is enabled for all Kubernetes clusters
tests.more_info: Kubernetes private clusters only have internal ip ranges, which ensures that their workloads are isolated from the public internet.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all Kubernetes clusters have private cluster enabled.

data.name: 7.16 Ensure Private Google Access is set on Kubernetes Engine Cluster Subnets
data.description: Private Google Access enables your cluster hosts, which have only private IP addresses, to communicate with Google APIs and services using an internal IP address rather than an external IP address.

tests.title: Private Access Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Private Google Access is enabled for all Subnets
tests.more_info: Private Google Access allows VM instances on a subnet to reach Google APIs and services without an IP address. This creates a more secure network for the internal communication.
tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the VPC Network service. 2. Enter the VPC. 3. Select the subnet in question. 4. Edit the subnet and enable Private Google Access.

data.name: 7.18 Ensure Kubernetes Clusters created with limited service account Access scopes for Project access
data.description: Access scopes are the legacy method of specifying permissions for your instance. Before the existence of IAM roles, access scopes were the only mechanism for granting permissions to service accounts.

tests.title: Cluster Least Privilege
tests.description: Ensures Kubernetes clusters using default service account are using minimal service account access scopes
tests.more_info: As a best practice, Kubernetes clusters should not be created with default service account. But if they are, Kubernetes default service account should be limited to minimal access scopes necessary to operate the clusters.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all Kubernetes clusters are created with minimal access scope.

data.name: 1.7 Ensure that Separation of duties is enforced while assigning service account related roles to users
data.description: It is recommended that the principle of 'Separation of Duties' is enforced while assigning service account related roles to users.

tests.title: Service Account Separation
tests.description: Ensures that no users have both the Service Account User and Service Account Admin role.
tests.more_info: Ensuring that no users have both roles follows separation of duties, where no user should have access to resources out of the scope of duty.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that no service accounts have both the Service Account User and Service Account Admin role attached.

data.name: 1.9 Ensure that Separation of duties is enforced while assigning KMS related roles to users
data.description: It is recommended that the principle of 'Separation of Duties' is enforced while assigning KMS related roles to users.

tests.title: KMS User Separation
tests.description: Ensures that no users have the KMS admin role and any one of the CryptoKey roles.
tests.more_info: Ensuring that no users have the KMS admin role and any one of the CryptoKey roles follows separation of duties, where no user should have access to resources out of the scope of duty.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that no service accounts have both the KMS admin role and any of CryptoKey roles attached.

data.name: 3.6 Ensure that SSH access is restricted from the internet
data.description: GCP `Firewall Rules` are specific to a `VPC Network`. Each rule either `allows` or `denies` traffic when its conditions are met. Generic `(0.0.0.0/0)` incoming traffic from internet to VPC or VM instance using `SSH` on `Port 22` can be avoided.

tests.title: Open SSH
tests.description: Determines if TCP port 22 for SSH is open to the public
tests.more_info: While some ports such as HTTP and HTTPS are required to be open to the public to function properly, more sensitive services such as SSH should be restricted to known IP addresses.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 22 to known IP addresses.

data.name: 3.7 Ensure that RDP access is restricted from the internet
data.description: GCP `Firewall Rules` are specific to a `VPC Network`. Each rule either `allows` or `denies` traffic when its conditions are met. Generic `(0.0.0.0/0)` incoming traffic from internet to VPC or VM instance using `RDP` on `Port 3389` can be avoided.

tests.title: Open RDP
tests.description: Determines if TCP port 3389 for RDP is open to the public
tests.more_info: While some ports such as HTTP and HTTPS are required to be open to the public to function properly, more sensitive services such as RDP should be restricted to known IP addresses.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 3389 to known IP addresses.

data.name: 3.8 Ensure Private Google Access is enabled for all subnetwork in VPC Network
data.description: Private Google Access enables virtual machine instances on a subnet to reach Google APIs and services using an internal IP address rather than an external IP address.

tests.title: Private Access Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Private Google Access is enabled for all Subnets
tests.more_info: Private Google Access allows VM instances on a subnet to reach Google APIs and services without an IP address. This creates a more secure network for the internal communication.
tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the VPC Network service. 2. Enter the VPC. 3. Select the subnet in question. 4. Edit the subnet and enable Private Google Access.

data.name: 4.6 Ensure VM disks for critical VMs are encrypted with Customer-Supplied Encryption Keys (CSEK)
data.description: If you supply your own encryption keys, Google uses your key to protect the Google-generated keys used to encrypt and decrypt your data. By default, Google Compute Engine encrypts all data at rest.

tests.title: CSEK Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Customer Supplied Encryption Key Encryption is enabled on disks
tests.more_info: Google encrypts all disks at rest by default. By using CSEK only the users with the key can access the disk. Anyone else, including Google, cannot access the disk data.
tests.recommended_action: CSEK can only be configured when creating a disk. Delete the disk and redeploy with CSEK.

data.name: 7.9 Ensure Container-Optimized OS (cos) is used for Kubernetes Engine Clusters Node image
data.description: Container-Optimized OS is an operating system image for your Compute Engine VMs that is optimized for running Docker containers.

tests.title: COS Image Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes cluster nodes have Container-Optimized OS enabled
tests.more_info: Container-Optimized OS is optimized to enhance node security. It is backed by a team at Google that can quickly patch it.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Container-Optimized OS on all Kubernetes cluster nodes

data.name: 7.17 Ensure default Service account is not used for Project access in Kubernetes Clusters
data.description: A service account is an identity that an instance or an application can use to run API requests on your behalf. This identity is used to identify applications running on your virtual machine instances to other Google Cloud Platform services.

tests.title: Default Service Account
tests.description: Ensures all Kubernetes cluster nodes are not using the default service account.
tests.more_info: Kubernetes cluster nodes should use customized service accounts that have minimal privileges to run. This reduces the attack surface in the case of a malicious attack on the cluster.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that no Kubernetes cluster nodes are using the default service account
